triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: Multi-UAV systems are the primary application domain for the fault-tolerant consensus control scheme proposed in the paper.

triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a predefined-time consensus protocol that extends consensus dynamics for multi-UAV systems.

triples.name: Fault tolerance
triples.relevance: Fault tolerance is a core requirement addressed through adaptive compensation mechanisms for actuator faults.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: An adaptive compensation mechanism is developed to improve fault tolerance by adjusting to actuator faults.

triples.name: Barrier function
triples.relevance: The paper constructs an output-dependent universal barrier function to enforce attitude constraints.

triples.name: Euler angles
triples.relevance: Euler angles are used to represent attitude in the UAV control system, with constraints managed via barrier functions.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control theory provides the foundation for designing the consensus tracking control scheme.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The multi-UAV system is a multi-agent system where coordination and consensus among agents are essential.
